channel.title: AirVantage through ethernet
channel.description: Hi, I'm using a Mangoh Green. As far as I can find, it is not possible to connect to AirVantage through the LAN/eth0 interface, but only through Cellular or WiFi connections. Are there any plans to realize Airvantage connectivity through LAN?

item.title: AirVantage through ethernet
item.dc:creator: nilsarve
item.description:
Thank you for the response asyal.
Made a new topic in the lagato forum:

Legato Forum – 11 May 20

Airvantage through Ethernet

Hello David Frey posted this in the mangoh forum November 2017: I talked to a couple people on the Legato team and they mentioned that the reason you cannot connect to AirVantage using the ethernet connection on the mangOH Green is that the...

Read full topic

item.title: AirVantage through ethernet
item.dc:creator: asyal
item.description:
dfrey:

I talked to a couple people on the Legato team and they mentioned that the reason you cannot connect to AirVantage using the ethernet connection on the mangOH Green is that the ethernet connection isn’t supported by the data connection service. The data connection service is responsible for establishing a data connection to the internet on demand. This is a known issue and there is some interest internally in improving the data connection service to support this feature. I don’t know when it might happen though.

maybe you can post this in forum.legato.io.

Read full topic

item.description:
I talked to a couple people on the Legato team and they mentioned that the reason you cannot connect to AirVantage using the ethernet connection on the mangOH Green is that the ethernet connection isn’t supported by the data connection service. The data connection service is responsible for establishing a data connection to the internet on demand. This is a known issue and there is some interest internally in improving the data connection service to support this feature. I don’t know when it might happen though.

Hi,

We will take your input back to the team. I dont believe there is any plan in the short term.

regards,
Ashish
